curriculum.overview: Golden Stars Schools operates a dual curriculum system, combining the Nigerian national curriculum with the British curriculum. This approach ensures our students receive a well-rounded education that prepares them for both local and international opportunities.

nigerian.title: Nigerian Curriculum
nigerian.description: The Nigerian curriculum provides students with a strong foundation in national values, culture, and educational standards. It prepares learners to understand, resolve problems, and make decisions within the Nigerian context and beyond.

british.title: British Curriculum
british.description: The British curriculum offers an international perspective with an outcome-based education approach. It assists learners in functioning at higher cognitive domains, developing critical thinking, creativity, and innovation skills.

levels.title: Nursery (Ages 6 months - 5 years)
levels.description: Our nursery program provides a safe, nurturing environment where young children develop foundational skills through play-based learning. We focus on cognitive, social, emotional, and physical development.

levels.title: Primary (Years 1-6, Ages 5-11)
levels.description: Our primary program builds strong foundations in literacy, numeracy, and critical thinking. Students explore a wide range of subjects through engaging, hands-on activities.

levels.title: Secondary (Years 7-12, Ages 11-17)
levels.description: Our secondary program prepares students for university and beyond with rigorous academic standards, leadership development, and comprehensive extracurricular opportunities.

levels.title: Sixth Form/Pre-Degree (Ages 16-19)
levels.description: Our sixth form program provides intensive preparation for university entrance, offering A-Levels, Cambridge programs, and foundation courses for both local and international universities.
